ContentDescription_V1: Respond to drama, expressing what they enjoy and why
Comment: Moved from VC1 Respond and Interpret strand to new VC2 Exploring strand

ContentDescription_V1: Explore ideas for characters and situations through dramatic play
Comment: No change

ContentDescription_V1: Explore ideas for characters and situations through dramatic play
Comment: Elaborated to enhance creative possibilities

ContentDescription_V1: Use voice, facial expression, movement and space to imagine and improvise characters and situations
Comment: Refined language that allows for broader exploration of creating drama

ContentDescription_V1: Present drama that communicates ideas and stories
Comment: This strand concerns the sharing process, not the content, which is now found in the VC2 Creating strand

ContentDescription_V1: Respond to drama, expressing what they enjoy and why, and why people in their local area make and perform drama, including drama of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples
Comment: Refined with greater focus on communities and cultures

ContentDescription_V1: Explore roles, characters and dramatic action in dramatic play, improvisation and process drama
Comment: Combined 2 content descriptions, and now open to practices and elements used

Comment: Combined 2 content descriptions, and now open to practices and elements used

ContentDescription_V1: Use voice, facial expression, movement and space to imagine and establish role and situation
Comment: Combined and refined with an emphasis on the process of creating

ContentDescription_V1: Present drama that communicates ideas, including stories from their community, to an audience
Comment: Refined with an emphasis on informal audience

ContentDescription_V1: Explore ideas and narrative structures through roles and situations and use empathy in their own improvisations and devised drama
Comment: Refined to include how drama is influenced by context

ContentDescription_V1: Identify intended purposes and meaning of drama, including the drama of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples

ContentDescription_V1: Explore ideas and narrative structures through roles and situations and use empathy in their own improvisations and devised drama
Comment: Refined and some content moved to Creating strand

ContentDescription_V1: Use voice, body, movement and language to sustain role and relationships and create dramatic action with a sense of time and place
Comment: Refined to include broader terminology in the skills used to create drama works

ContentDescription_V1: Explore ideas and narrative structures through roles and situations and use empathy in their own improvisations and devised drama
Comment: Refined to include broader terminology in the skills used to create drama works

ContentDescription_V1: Shape and perform dramatic action using narrative structures and tension in devised and scripted drama

ContentDescription_V1: Explore dramatic action, empathy and space in improvisations, play-building and scripted drama, to develop characters and situations
Comment: Refined to reflect the changed strand of Responding

ContentDescription_V1: Explain how the elements of drama and production elements communicate meaning by comparing drama from different social, cultural and historical contexts, including in the drama of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples
Comment: Refined to reflect the changed strand of Responding

ContentDescription_V1: Explain how the elements of drama and production elements communicate meaning by comparing drama from different social, cultural and historical contexts, including in the drama of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples
Comment: Refined with a new focus on revitalising culture

ContentDescription_V1: Explore dramatic action, empathy and space in improvisations, play-building and scripted drama, to develop characters and situations
Comment: Refined to include documentation practices and updates drama terminology

ContentDescription_V1: Develop skills and techniques of voice and movement to create character, mood and atmosphere and focus dramatic action
Comment: Refined to focus on the range of experiences, and introduces design areas

ContentDescription_V1: Perform devised and scripted drama that develops narrative and uses performance styles and design elements to engage an audience
Comment: Refined to focus on rehearsal and presentation, as content is found in other strands

ContentDescription_V1: Analyse how the elements of drama have been combined in devised and scripted drama to convey different forms, performance styles and dramatic meaning
Comment: Focus on exploration rather than end-product.

ContentDescription_V1: Identify and connect specific features and purposes of drama from contemporary and past times, including the drama of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples to explore viewpoints and enrich their drama making
Comment: Refined to focus on diversity of drama and theatre created by Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples and Indigenous Cultural and Intellectual Property rights

ContentDescription_V1: Develop and refine expressive skills in voice and movement to communicate ideas and dramatic action in different performance styles and conventions
Comment: Refined to be inclusive of design areas

Comment: Refined for clarity
